page.title: 18PROPOSED BYEPASS
page.content: Brockworth is in urgent need of a byepass because of the increasing traffic flow along Ermin St.,the A417 Trunk Road which splits the community in two.This road provides an important link between the M4 and M5 and is a major route from the South to the Midlands and the NW. Conjestion,noise, fumes,safety of pedestrians,and future expansion of the Trading Estate are all important factors. Three routes were considered: YELLOW Southern favoured by 11% More effect on property,less economic RED Northern favoured by 64% Major impact on landscape,most costly BLUE favoured by 25%. Severe on property,best econ.return. THE SECRETARY OF STATE'S DECISION. The BLUE ROUTE slightly modified in order to minimise adverse effects on properties. To be public enquiries.
